title: Bonetcx
author: Bonetcx
content: Hello I am new in antminer and electricity.I have a nema 5-20 outlet supposed to be 240 volts. What adapter do I need to connect with my antminer s9.Adapter, cables etc.....Appreciate all your help.Thank you

comments.author: paid2
comments.body: You should have a look on this page : Choose the correct power cord for your miner (https://support.bitmain.com/hc/en-us/articles/360018041153-Choose-the-correct-power-cord-for-your-miner)Here the detailed specs for each Bitmain PSU : https://support.bitmain.com/hc/en-us/sections/360002496033

comments.author: NotFuzzyWarm
comments.created_time: February 02, 2023, 03:59:10 PMLast edit: February 02, 2023, 04:22:50 PM by NotFuzzyWarm
comments.body: Quote from: Bonetcx on February 02, 2023, 03:12:27 AMHello I am new in antminer and electricity.I have a nema 5-20 outlet supposed to be 240 volts. What adapter do I need to connect with my antminer s9.Adapter, cables etc.....Appreciate all your help.Thank youNEMA 5's are for 125VAC - NOT 240v. 240VAC connectors are NEMA 6-x so you had better make sure what the voltage is. The connectors look similar but the horizontal and vertical blades are on different sides so they cannot be accidentally plugged into the wrong mating half.

comments.author: Bonetcx
comments.body: Quote from: NotFuzzyWarm on February 02, 2023, 03:59:10 PMQuote from: Bonetcx on February 02, 2023, 03:12:27 AMHello I am new in antminer and electricity.I have a nema 5-20 outlet supposed to be 240 volts. What adapter do I need to connect with my antminer s9.Adapter, cables etc.....Appreciate all your help.Thank youNEMA 5's are for 125VAC - NOT 240v. 240VAC connectors are NEMA 6-x so you had better make sure what the voltage is. The connectors look similar but the horizontal and vertical blades are on different sides so they cannot be accidentally plugged into the wrong mating half.If it is possible to have 2 psu on a different outlets (110v) to 1 antminer s9 so it divide de consumption??

comments.author: NotFuzzyWarm
comments.body: QuoteIf it is possible to have 2 psu on a different outlets (110v) to 1 antminer s9 so it divide de consumption?Huh?Yes but...You must NEVER have the 2 PSU's feeding the same hash board. Connecting multiple PSU's in parallel will result in them fighting each other and eventually things go poof rather quickly.Use 1 PSU to power the controller and 1 or 2 hash boards (turn this one on 1st) and the 2nd PSU to power the remaining boards.

comments.author: Bonetcx
comments.body: Quote from: NotFuzzyWarm on February 02, 2023, 04:49:56 PMQuoteIf it is possible to have 2 psu on a different outlets (110v) to 1 antminer s9 so it divide de consumption?Huh?Yes but...You must NEVER have the 2 PSU's feeding the same hash board. Connecting multiple PSU's in parallel will result in them fighting each other and eventually things go poof rather quickly.Use 1 PSU to power the controller and 1 or 2 hash boards (turn this one on 1st) and the 2nd PSU to power the remaining boards.Thank you....I will keep you up to date of the status. ðŸ˜„

comments.author: Maxre
comments.created_time: March 07, 2023, 05:47:34 PMLast edit: March 08, 2023, 07:21:15 AM by Maxre
comments.body: Quote from: Bonetcx on February 02, 2023, 03:12:27 AMHello I am new in antminer and electricity.I have a nema 5-20 outlet supposed to be 240 volts. What adapter do I need to connect with my antminer s9.Adapter, cables etc.....Appreciate all your help.Thank youI think that you should have A powerful PSU like 300 bolts and you should also run only 1 Antminer on this PSU Because it will be a total benefits for you. There is a lot of guidance and you be redirected here too.https://www.bitmain.com/

comments.author: MIner1448
comments.body: To connect your Antminer S9 to a NEMA 5-20 outlet, you'll need a power supply unit (PSU) that is compatible with the Antminer S9 and can convert the 240 volts from the NEMA 5-20 outlet to the appropriate voltage required by the miner.Antminer S9 typically requires a 1600W power supply unit, so you can search for a 1600W PSU that has a NEMA 5-20 plug, or you can use a NEMA 5-20 to C13 power cord to connect the PSU to the outlet.In any case, you can find these recommendations on the Internet, and then you decide how to connect.

comments.author: NotFuzzyWarm
comments.body: Folks, NEMA-5 plugs and receptacles are for 120vac NOT 240V!It is the NEMA-6 series that are for 200-250VAC. Of course they are not interchangeable.
